channel.title: GPR survey on Sandberg GPR
channel.description: Recent content in GPR survey on Sandberg GPR

item.title: Ensuring a successful GPR survey
item.description: Five things to ensure a successful GPR survey. An experienced GPR surveyor using the correct equipment and methods is key to a successful…

item.title: Chimney Flue Location
item.description: Google description is called summary.

item.title: What can Ground Penetrating Radar be used for?
item.description: Find out how GPR works? Whatâ€™s it for? Can it help you? In this article, we make a business case for Ground Penetrating Radar in the construction industry.

item.title: Warehouse tendon location survey with on-site mark-up
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR tendon location survey methods for floor slab tendon location with in situ mark-up in a working warehouse.

item.title: Wellington monument investigation
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR to investigate the construction detail and understand this unique and somewhat complex Grade II listed monument.

item.title: Pad foundation location survey
item.description: How we used GPR to locate and map pad foundations, including construction detail, on a site in Waterloo.

item.title: Concrete Floor Slab Surveys
item.description: Our GPR surveys provide a fast and efficient NDT means of surveying concrete floor slabs to determine construction detail and identify defects.

item.title: Locate Services in Slabs
item.description: Non-intrusive surveys to locate services in floor slabs. We find the services for you so that you can drill and undertake intrusive works safely.

item.title: Locating embedded metal in masonry
item.description: Our NDT GPR surveys can locate embedded metal in masonry, including structural frames, fixing cramps and pins. Ideal for listed and heritage buildings.

item.title: Locating post-tensioned tendons in concrete
item.description: Our NDT GPR surveys can locate tendons, including their depth, in pre-stressed and post-tensioned concrete. Essential prior to cutting, coring or drilling.

item.title: Locating underfloor heating pipes
item.description: Our GPR surveys provide a fast and efficient NDT means of locating underfloor heating pipes. Works for metal and plastic. Locate before you cut or drill!

item.title: Rebar mapping and concrete imaging surveys
item.description: High-resolution GPR rebar mapping, reinforcing steel location and concrete imaging surveys to depths of 400mm. Superior resolution to other methods.

item.title: Retaining wall surveys
item.description: Our non-intrusive GPR surveys can determine retaining wall construction detail, thickness and identify defects. Access is only required to one side.

item.title: Slab thickness measurement surveys
item.description: Non-intrusive surveys to provide slab thickness readings for concrete slabs, screed layers, bridge decks, road construction and more. Only one-sided access required.

item.title: Wall Thickness
item.description: Need to determine wall thickness or party wall detail but only have access to one side? We can help. Our GPR surveys can determine wall thickness, wall construction and more….

item.title: Void detection and location
item.description: Our GPR surveys can detect voids beneath slabs. By scanning on a regular orthogonal grid, the void location and extent can be determined and plotted.

item.title: Sinkhole detection
item.description: GPR is an excellent non-intrusive survey technique for sinkhole detection and location. We typically use a dual-frequency GPR system…

item.title: Pile cap location survey
item.description: Need to locate pile caps? Sandberg can undertake non-intrusive pile cap location surveys and determine slab thickness and reinforcement distribution.

item.title: Construction Detail Verification
item.description: Using GPR to verify construction detail and compliance with current legislation and standards. Suitable for floor slabs, concrete and masonry walls…

item.title: Why you must locate reinforcing steel in concrete before you drill
item.description: “Locate concrete reinforcing steel before you find it with your drill bit, core barrel or saw! Work safe and avoid dangerous and costly hits”.

item.title: Concrete Scanning
item.description: Concrete scanning covers a range of techniques to establish detail within concrete including rebar location, mapping and imaging, thickness and tendons.

item.title: Filler joist location in floor slabs
item.description: GPR is very effective in detecting and locating filler joist locations in slabs and can even differentiate between dense reinforcement and filler joists.

item.title: Concrete inspection â€“ locating hazards and defects in concrete
item.description: GPR concrete inspection enables you to see into the sub-surface to determine construction detail, locate dangers, and identify defects in concrete.
